publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-1067 Mrs Nanette Milne: Congratulations to the University of Aberdeen on $1.85 million Gift-That the Parliament congratulates the University of Aberdeen on securing what is believed to be the single largest gift committed by an American fund to the study of humanities within a Scottish institution; notes that the $1.85 million gift will fund what is to be known as the Gluckman Chair of Irish and Scottish Studies; recognises that the university's Research Institute of Irish and Scottish Studies is the first of its kind in the world for graduate study and research on the history, language, literature and culture of Ireland and Scotland and one of the largest concentrations of Scottish or Irish expertise in any European university, and notes that the first holder of the new chair will be Professor Tom Devine, University Research Professor in Scottish history and Director of the Arts and Humanities Research Board Centre for Irish and Scottish Studies at the University of Aberdeen. R

S2M-1067 Mrs Nanette Milne: Congratulations to the University of Aberdeen on $1.85 million Gift-That the Parliament congratulates the University of Aberdeen on securing what is believed to be the single largest gift committed by an American fund to the study of humanities within a Scottish institution; notes that the $1.85 million gift will fund what is to be known as the Gluckman Chair of Irish and Scottish Studies; recognises that the university's Research Institute of Irish and Scottish Studies is the first of its kind in the world for graduate study and research on the history, language, literature and culture of Ireland and Scotland and one of the largest concentrations of Scottish or Irish expertise in any European university, and notes that the first holder of the new chair will be Professor Tom Devine, University Research Professor in Scottish history and Director of the Arts and Humanities Research Board Centre for Irish and Scottish Studies at the University of Aberdeen. R Supported by: Mr David Davidson*, Robert Brown*, Mr Jamie Stone*, Rob Gibson*, Murray Tosh*, Ms Sandra White*

S2M-1067 Congratulations to the University of Aberdeen on $1.85 million Gift (lodged on 18 March 2004) Alex Johnstone*, Brian Adam*, Robin Harper*, David Mundell*, Eleanor Scott*, Shiona Baird*, Donald Gorrie*
S2M-1067 Congratulations to the University of Aberdeen on $1.85 million Gift (lodged on 18 March 2004) Alex Neil*, Mr Ted Brocklebank*
S2M-1067 Congratulations to the University of Aberdeen on $1.85 million Gift (lodged on 18 March 2004) Richard Lochhead*, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*
S2M-1067 Congratulations to the University of Aberdeen on $1.85 million Gift (lodged on 18 March 2004) Mrs Margaret Ewing*
S2M-1067 Congratulations to the University of Aberdeen on $1.85 million Gift (lodged on 18 March 2004) Fiona Hyslop*
S2M-1067 Congratulations to the University of Aberdeen on $1.85 million Gift (lodged on 18 March 2004) Phil Gallie*, John Scott*
S2M-1067 Congratulations to the University of Aberdeen on $1.85 million Gift (lodged on 18 March 2004) Dr Jean Turner*
